transcript: when my grandfather came to North America from Eastern Europe he started an egg business at a local farmers market he had to take a loan out on his home in order to afford the cost of actually renting this particular stall if this did not work the result of that would be no food on the table no roof over their head well one thing that has changed dramatically the cost of failure of starting a business today is by far the lowest it's ever been that is remarkable it's risk adjusted return right is that everyone here now can get endless shots on goal right now because of how accessible entrepreneurship is you basically just keep taking lottery tickets and if you lose then you just buy another scratch off
